page.title: 03SEALE HAYNE COLLEGE.
page.content: {Seale Hayne College}is unique. It is the only agricultural college in Britain whose buildings were purpose designed and built. It is set among 200 hectares of farmlands,3 miles from Newton Abbot. Founded under the will of the{Rt.Hon.Charles Seale Hayne}and started in 1912,the college was initially used as a naval hospital during the 1st World War. Now Britain's biggest national agricultural college,it is largely funded by the Department of Education and Science.Its growth has been considerable and the increasing scope of its curriculum has meant the dropping of the word 'agriculture' from the college name. The college community,47 in 1920,now nears 1000,with 5% of the students coming from overseas,particularly Africa and Western Europe.The ratio of men to
